definition: To descend or sink below the horizon, typically referring to the setting of the sun or another celestial body. It is commonly used metaphorically to describe the act of perishing, being destroyed, or experiencing a downfall.

examples.english: He won't let himself go under.

examples.german: Die Firma wird untergehen, wenn sie nicht konkurrenzfähig bleibt.
examples.english: The company will go under if it doesn't remain competitive.
The truth must not be suppressed.
